title: How to Make Microwave Treacle Pudding

steps.headline: Oil the inside of your bowl lightly.
steps.description: Only oil about halfway up the sides, or the pudding may not rise correctly.

steps.headline: Combine the flour, suet, and sugar in a large bowl.
Combine the remaining ingredients in a smaller bowl.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap.
steps.description: Make it snug, but not so tight that steam cannot vent.

steps.headline: Rotate the bowl.
steps.description: This isn't necessary for 'turntable' style microwaves

steps.headline: Remove from the microwave, and quickly cover with plastic wrap again.
Allow the pudding to rest for another 2 minutes.
Turn the bowl over, onto a plate.

tyn: Microwaveable bowl that will hold 4 cups of liquid
text: Oil the inside of your bowl lightly. Only oil about halfway up the sides, or the pudding may not rise correctly. Combine the flour, suet, and sugar in a large bowl. Mix well. Combine the remaining ingredients in a smaller bowl. Mix well. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Again, mix well. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap. Make it snug, but not so tight that steam cannot vent. Microwave on HIGH for 2 minutes.  Remove the plastic wrap.  Rotate the bowl. This isn't necessary for 'turntable' style microwaves Microwave another 2 minutes on HIGH.  Remove from the microwave, and quickly cover with plastic wrap again.  Allow the pudding to rest for another 2 minutes. Then remove the plastic wrap. Turn the bowl over, onto a plate.  Enjoy your freshly 'steamed' treacle pudding!
